title_1: The Lenten Season - Preparing for Death & New Life
scripture_body:
1 Have mercy on me, O God,
according to your unfailing love;
according to your great compassion
blot out my transgressions.
2 Wash away all my iniquity
and cleanse me from my sin.
3 For I know my transgressions,
and my sin is always before me.
4 Against you, you only, have I sinned
and done what is evil in your sight,
so that you are proved right when you speak
and justified when you judge.
5 Surely I was sinful at birth,
sinful from the time my mother conceived me.
6 Surely you desire truth in the inner parts;
you teach me wisdom in the inmost place.
7 Cleanse me with hyssop, and I will be clean;
wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.
8 Let me hear joy and gladness;
let the bones you have crushed rejoice.
9 Hide your face from my sins
and blot out all my iniquity.
10 Create in me a pure heart, O God,
and renew a steadfast spirit within me.
11 Do not cast me from your presence
or take your Holy Spirit from me.
12 Restore to me the joy of your salvation
and grant me a willing spirit, to sustain me.
goal: To understand more deeply God’s forgiveness of our own sins, and how that in turn transforms us to become people of forgiveness.
background: Repentance and sorrow over sins is a prominent emphasis during Lent. As we reflect on the ways that we need the constant forgiveness of God in the face of our ongoing sin, this study looks at our need to forgive others and the consequences of carrying unforgiveness. The emphasis is on forgiveness as an act of relational generosity.
question1: 1. OUR SIN: The Psalmist openly laments about his sinfulness before God. What words does the Psalmist use to speak of his sin? What do they teach us about sin?
question2: 2. OUR CLEANSING: The Psalmist pleads for God’s mercy by asking to be cleansed. What does this psalm teach us about how we can approach God when we become aware of deep and troubling sin in our lives? How does this psalm hint at Jesus?
question3: 3. OUR RENEWAL: In verses 10-12, the Psalmist tells us what it looks like when a repentant heart is renewed. What are some qualities or traits of this renewed heart? How would a heart renewed like this relate with others?
prayer: Praise God for his mercy, grace, and forgiveness. He is compassionate, slow to anger, and rich in love.
Confess that we too often take our sins too lightly. We are not grieved by the fact that our sins are first sins against God.
Ask God to make alive in our hearts his love that is found in Jesus, and that in turn his love would compel us to become people of forgiveness, rich in grace and mercy toward others.

worship.body:
As morning dawns and evening fades
You inspire songs of praise
That rise from earth to touch Your heart
and glorify Your Name

Your Name is a strong and mighty tower
Your Name is a shelter like no other
Your Name, let the nations sing it louder
'Cause nothing has the power to save
But Your Name

Jesus, in Your Name we pray
Come and fill our hearts today
Lord, give us strength to live for You
and glorify Your Name

worship.header: Jesus I My Cross Have Taken
worship.body:
Jesus I my cross have taken,
all to leave and follow Thee
Destitute despised forsaken,
Thou from hence my all shall be
Perish every fond ambition,
all I’ve sought or hoped or known
Yet how rich is my condition!
God and heaven are still my own

Let the world despise and leave me,
they have left my Savior too
Human hearts and looks deceive me,
Thou art not like them untrue
O while Thou dost smile upon me,
God of wisdom love and might
Foes may hate and friends disown me,
show Thy face and all is bright

Hasten on from grace to glory,
armed by faith and winged by prayer
Heavens eternal days before me,
God’s own hand shall guide me there
Soon shall close my earthly mission,
swift shall pass my pilgrim days
Hope shall change to glad fruition,
faith to sight and prayer to praise

You stood before creation
eternity in Your hand
You spoke the earth into motion
My soul now to stand

You stood before my failure
And carried the cross for my shame
My sin weighed upon Your shoulders
My soul now to stand

So what can I say
And what could I do
But offer this heart O God
Completely to You

So I'll walk upon salvation
Your Spirit alive in me
This life to declare Your promise
My soul now to stand

So I'll stand
With arms high and heart abandoned
In awe of the One who gave it all
I'll stand
My soul Lord to You surrendered
All I am is Yours
